image.altText: A boy in a white shirt smiles as he looks over his shoulder at the camera

items.synopsis: A private college in Adelaide's north is fined $420,000 for breaching the Work Health and Safety Act after a teenage student drowned during a 2021 school camping trip.

title.children: Private college fined after teenager's death during school trip

image.altText: A woman sits at a table typing on a laptop in front of a white wall. An artwork next to her of an eyeball appears to look at her

items.synopsis: Thousands of Australian public sector staff will be allowed to permanently work from home following a "groundbreaking" union deal — but Adelaide business lobby groups say any move to follow suit at a local level would be a "death knell" for CBD retail.

title.children: Work-from-home deal 'groundbreaking', but SA business groups warn of CBD 'death knell'

image.altText: A woman wearing a bright yellow face mask look down at a nurse putting a sticker bandaid on her arm after a vaccination.

items.synopsis: Flu vaccine uptake in recent months across Australia is almost 2 million down on what it was last year, with experts blaming COVID 'fatigue' and cost-of-living pressures. Two students have died from influenza this week, including an 11-year-old Queensland girl and a teenager from NSW.

title.children: Flu vaccine numbers are down by almost two million. What's to blame?

image.altText: Two police cars surround a black car

items.synopsis: The four girls, aged 14 to 15, are charged over the alleged incident in Adelaide's inner north-east.

title.children: Group of teenage girls carjack ride-share Lexus at knifepoint, SA police say

image.altText: Commonwealth Bank chief executive Matt Comyn looks at the camera in an office setting.

items.synopsis: Only 60 per cent of the Reserve Bank's increases in the cash rate have been felt by households so far, says CBA boss.

title.children: Young renters under most strain, but full mortgage pain yet to be felt, warns CBA boss

image.altText: A woman in a hard hat has her back to the camera and stands on Whakaari.

items.synopsis: The criminal trial into the Whakaari White Island disaster in New Zealand hears evidence from its first Australian witness, including details of their harrowing journey back to the mainland.

title.children: After she was covered in hot volcanic ash, travel blogger Annie endured a horrifying journey to get help

image.altText: Russian Major General Ivan Popov in a military uniform.

items.synopsis: A Russian general says he has been dismissed as a commander after telling the military leadership about the dire situation on the frontline in Ukraine.

title.children: Russian general dismissed after accusing top officers of betraying soldiers

image.altText: Vince Colosimo walks out of court with his lawyer.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for the 56-year-old said the film and TV star had struggled with mental health and substance abuse issues while racking up more than $60,000 in fines.

title.children: Actor Vince Colosimo has tens of thousands in traffic fines wiped by court

image.altText: Peter Dutton in the prime minister's courtyard

items.synopsis: As the government weighs whether to keep or replace Philip Lowe as RBA governor, Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says two key candidates from Treasury and Finance should be ruled out of the running.

title.children: Former RBA governor says Dutton 'silly to rule out' candidates from Treasury and Finance as next Reserve Bank head

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith arrives at court

items.synopsis: A judge who dismissed Ben Roberts-Smith’s defamation case placed weight on unreliable or improbable accounts from witnesses and "cherry-picked" from the testimony of others, the war veteran will argue during an appeal.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith judge accused of 'cherry-picking' evidence as war veteran's lawyers launch appeal

image.altText: man with black beanie, brown coat and glasses sits on bed on flatbed ute with pet dog

items.synopsis: In only four months, the Wimmera's only homelessness outreach worker has found more than 60 rough sleepers. Injured abattoir worker Shane is one of them — and the number of people like him is expected to "explode".

title.children: Shane sleeps on a ute tray at night. He pretends he's camping to save face

image.altText: Tom Liberatore stands in a tackle by Braeden Campbell who is horizontal to the ground

items.synopsis: The Sydney Swans are playing for pride — can they put a dent in the Western Bulldogs' finals aspirations at the SCG? Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Swans seeking a boost against Bulldogs at SCG

image.altText: An indigenous man and woman wearing a red and white football jersey with their hands on their hips.

items.synopsis: From the west coast of the United States, rapper The Kid LAROI is making his mark on his former hometown in outback New South Wales.

title.children: Rapper The Kid LAROI sponsors outback footy club's Indigenous guernsey

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a suit pushes his fingertips together onstage in front of a black and white backdrop.

items.synopsis: The startup, called xAI, will be led by Mr Musk, who is already the CEO of electric car maker Tesla, CEO of rocket launch company SpaceX and owner of Twitter.

title.children: Elon Musk, who has warned of AI's potential for 'civilisational destruction', launches own AI startup

image.altText: A Vietnamese Australian man smiles with his hands embracing his smiling wife.

items.synopsis: Australian man Chau Van Kham says his faith and the support of his family and community helped him survive the past four-and-a-half years in detention in Vietnam.

title.children: Australian detained in Vietnam for more than four years opens up about how he survived in prison

image.altText: A jetty closed with a 'danger' sign erected at its entry point

items.synopsis: The Yankalilla mayor wants the state government to cover the cost of repairs and maintenance for all of South Australia's jetties, rather than leave it to councils that cannot afford it.

title.children: Second Valley jetty to reopen with temporary fix but Yankalilla mayor calls on SA government to do more

image.altText: Man standing near a postie bike with box, swag and helmet on the bag, holds up shopping bag and smiles.

items.synopsis: A motorcycle race crash left this 61-year-old with a permanent limp and restricted use of his left side. But it hasn't stopped him from charging ahead at whatever life's thrown at him.

title.children: A devastating motorcycle crash at 19 didn't stopped Michael from riding a postie bike across Australia

image.altText: a handful of free-range eggs

items.synopsis: An egg industry advocate says farmers will need to be compensated if a suggested end date for battery hens in Australia becomes a reality.

title.children: Battery eggs on the way out — eventually — as ministers agree they have to go

image.altText: A 3D model of the building that burnt down in Surry Hills

items.synopsis: The century-old former hat factory caught fire on a Thursday afternoon. Within seven minutes of the first triple-0 call, the entire building, in the most densely populated part of Sydney, was an inferno.

title.children: Unravelling the inferno that reduced this century-old former hat factory to rubble

image.altText: Stephen Nutt

items.synopsis: Death threats from suspected foreign agents are a common occurrence in Australia's multicultural communities but the Australian Federal Police says they haven't been able to lay any charges in five years.

title.children: AFP 'not up to scratch' as zero charges laid for foreign interference through social media

image.altText: People board a plane from the tarmac.

items.synopsis: The new carrier will cut routes and slash the number of flights to some destinations, saying it wants to improve reliability while citing a lack of "sustainable demand".

title.children: New Australian airline Bonza scraps five routes, reduces regional flights due to low demand

image.altText: Rho Ophiuchi cloud complex, with brightly-coloured space plumes of space dust and stars

items.synopsis: The James Webb Space Telescope has given us another stunning image, this time revealing a close up a stellar nursery.

title.children: NASA's 'chaotic' new image reveals detail undetectable to the human eye

image.altText: Images of round metallic objects known as spherules

items.synopsis: Scientists from Harvard University have collected fragments believed to belong to a huge interstellar meteor, but PNG officials say the research was conducted within their waters without the required permits.

title.children: An exciting discovery leads to controversy as Harvard scientists collect fragments from interstellar meteor

image.altText: A woman and a child.

items.synopsis: Foodbank Australia is calling for more funding for school breakfast programs, with a growing number of families struggling to send children to school with full bellies.

title.children: Mum-of-10 forced to cut back on school lunches as food prices 'out of control'

image.altText: Huw Edwards holding a sheet of paper sitting at a news desk

items.synopsis: The BBC presenter facing allegations he paid a young person thousands of pounds for sexually explicit photos is Huw Edwards, the BBC reports, citing a statement from his wife.

title.children: Highest-paid journalist at BBC, Huw Edwards, named as presenter accused of paying for explicit teen photos

image.altText: A man being taken into custody by NSW police.

items.synopsis: A 22-year-old man is charged with murder over the shooting death in May of a 24-year-old man in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: 'He has blood on his hands': Sydney man charged over alleged gangland shooting murder

image.altText: composite garside and former partner

items.synopsis: Harry Garside's ex-girlfriend is charged with assault and stalking, a month after the Olympian's domestic assault case was dropped by police.

title.children: Former girlfriend of boxer Harry Garside charged with domestic violence offences

image.altText: Car chase Blue Mountains

items.synopsis: Police fire shots and two men are arrested after a two-hour chase across Western Sydney this morning.

title.children: Police fire shots at car before two-hour pursuit through streets of Western Sydney

image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

items.synopsis: An aged care residence in Queensland has been flying in nurses from Melbourne in a last-ditch bid to stay open but even that won't prevent its doors closing amid a dire nursing shortfall.

title.children: More aged care facilities to close as sector reels from staff shortages

image.altText: A middle-aged caucasian man in a dark suit and red tie faces to the left while speaking. Behind him is an Aboriginal flag.

items.synopsis: Australia's agriculture minister says improved monitoring for animals from farm to killfloor will help protect producers from biosecurity threats and appease consumers keen to know the origins of their meal.

title.children: Focus on livestock tracing intensifies under new strategy to protect agricultural industry

image.altText: A man wearing a cream-coloured sweater sitting on a white sofa inside a house

items.synopsis: The former One Direction star was interviewed by Alex Cooper, the host of Call Her Daddy, one of Spotify's most-streamed podcasts. These were the biggest moments he revealed.

title.children: Zayn Malik opens up about One Direction departure in first interview in six years

image.altText: A designed image showing John Zeitoune, Jye West and a building bearing an ACU logo.

items.synopsis: The Australian Catholic University has launched an internal inquiry after the ABC discovered the founder of the company providing its on-campus security has been charged with corruption — and had a secret business relationship with an employee overseeing its security contract.

title.children: 'I was told to shut up': Australian Catholic University accused of ignoring concerns about security contractor

image.altText: Hayley Atwell, a white brunette woman, and Tom Cruise, a white brunette middle-aged man, are in a car looking at the rear window

items.synopsis: The now late-middle-aged Ethan Hunt returns with his posse of sidekick operatives to take down a menacing sentient AI — and a few past foes — one analog stunt at a time.

title.children: Mission Impossible 7 promised Tom Cruise’s irresistibly deranged Hollywood charm — did it deliver?

image.altText: A car park at an outback resort with a red cliff in background.

items.synopsis: A resort west of Alice Springs will close while owners negotiate a water pipeline to be built from a bore 18 kilometres away.

title.children: Outback resort closes after water transportation costs make facility economically unviable
